title: Pellegrini 2014 Olivet Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Fleshy and briny, this wine hails from the producer's own marquee vineyard, situated in the heart of the Olivet Lane district. Ripe, with a buttery undertone, it's classic in its rendering of Gravenstein apple and pear flavors—balanced, yet with a robust frame.

title: Van Duzer 2014 Homestead Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is 100% Pommard clone, bright and spicy in the nose. The fruit flavors are sharp and penetrating, with brambly berries and a touch of pine sap.

title: Viñas del Cenit 2014 Aleo Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: Dark, earthy, herbal berry flavors are full-force on a nose. Plenty of grip and spunk drive a firm palate. Cherry, plum, berry and chocolate flavors make for a rich Tempranillo with lasting toasty darkness to the finish. Drink through 2020.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: Trione 2014 River Road Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Perfumed with rose and lavender, this wine has robust tannins and dominant oak notes, both in support of its ripe, concentrated red fruit. Woody, herbal components complement the lushness, framed by gravelly texture.

title: Buena Vista 2014 The Founder Red (Sonoma County)
description: This intensely ripe wine is made predominantly from Cabernet Sauvignon, with smaller amounts of Malbec and Merlot. Its waxy cherry, currant and blueberry flavers are laced wtih milk chocolate and smoky oak richness, a dash of high-toned acidity sparking on the finish.

title: Balestri Valda 2014 Vigneto Sengialta  (Soave Classico)
description: Aromas of pressed honeysuckle and orchard fruit lead the nose while the vibrant savory palate doles out ripe peach, yellow apple and a hint of lemon zest. An almond note lends a pleasantly bitter finish.

title: Domaine de la Foliette 2014 Tradition Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: Vinified in wood, this wine is rich with swathes of ripe lemon and green-plum flavors. Balanced between great fruit and a mineral pepper character, the wine is both refreshing and textured. It is ready to drink.

title: Flora Springs 2014 Holy Smoke Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This wine's firm, sizable tannins underscore mountain sage and brush aromas, as layers of red and black cherry come into focus. Medium bodied and gravelly in texture, it shows power within a comfortable frame of integrated oak.

title: Raymond 2014 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: From the warm appellation, this wine offers moderate structure and undeniable ripeness—a deep, brooding expression of dark chocolate, plum and leather.

title: Serca 2014 AleAnd Reserva Cabernet Franc (Valle de Uco)
description: Big, bold blackberry and mulled-plum aromas are ripe, briary and turn more raisiny the longer this wine sits. Raw, tart acidity and firm tannins offer structure. This wine has a palate of prune and stewed meat, with a rich yet rugged feel. Drink through 2021.

title: L'Avenir 2014 Classic Red (Stellenbosch)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon-based blend, with 25% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Franc, is complex and intriguing. It boasts a full profile of ripe fruit tones, expressed in layers of baked cherry, plum and rhubarb cake that are accented by notes of cured bacon, leather and pressed purple flowers. The palate is surprisingly smooth and silky, thanks to resolved, approachable tannins and a lingering sweet-smoke hit on the finish.

title: Lange 2014 Three Hills Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This high-wire wine skirts along tart red fruits with a stiff herbal spine. Sourced from Lange Estate, Freedom Hill and Yamhill vineyards, it was aged in 40% new French oak. A nice streak of espresso, licorice and char completes the finish.

title: Colene Clemens 2014 Adriane Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Pretty raspberry fruit coalesces in midpalate with a bright, spicy, flavor-boosting kick. It's young, fresh and nicely balanced. Drink now–2020.

title: Colene Clemens 2014 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Strikingly bright yellow-gold in hue, this is a rich, almost oily style, replete with flavors of buttered nuts and caramel apples. It's quite delicious and should be consumed now through 2020.

title: Caymus 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This large-production offering from the famous producer comes across as slightly confected, with a distinct marshmallow note on the nose and palate. Soft, smooth vanilla and cherry flavors contribute additional richness and reward for fans of a luxurious style.

title: Austin Hope 2014 Grenache (Templeton Gap District)
description: Roasted blueberry aromas meet prune, caramel and purple flower notes on the nose of this port-like bottling, which is rich and inviting but not very reminiscent of Grenache. It's soft and thick on the palate, with caramel, fudge and coffee candy flavors, and would make a great pairing for dessert.

title: Brave & Maiden 2014 Limited Estate Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Only one barrel of this limited release wine was produced. It shows baked black cherry, caramel and barbecue smoke notes on the nose. The palate offers more smoky character, along with blackberry, boysenberry and anise flavors. It's well structured, with background notes of dried herb and spice that carry into the finish.

title: Scott Harvey 2014 J&S Reserve Barbera (Amador County)
description: This medium-bodied wine has wild berry aromas, rich cherry syrup and vanilla flavors and a lively but smooth texture. It tastes extremely floral and candy-like without being literally sweet.

title: Goose Bay 2014 Kosher Reserve Fumé Sauvignon Blanc (South Island)
description: Starting to show its age with a pale golden hue, this fumé is classy and restrained. Aromas of waxy lemon, pineapple and green bean mingle with base notes of butterscotch and smoke from the oak. The palate offers less excitement with the fruit disappearing some and searing acidity taking over. Nevertheless, this wine would be a versatile pairing for a variety of dishes.

title: Easton 2014 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Effusive fruit flavors and a vibrant texture make this wine easy to pair with a meal. Spicy, chocolatey aromas meet cherry and raspberry flavors while full body lends richness in the mouthfeel and length on the finish.

title: Lange 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A step up from the Willamette Valley cuvée, this is a barrel selection from the same eight vineyards. One-third was new French oak, adding a hint of toast around wild raspberry fruit with a peppery note.

title: Les Frères Couillaud 2014 Château de la Ragotière Vallet  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This is a beautifully fruity wine with great acidity and citrus flavors contrasting with ripe apple and melon fruitiness. The wine is cool, crisp, full of juicy acidity, and ready to drink now.

title: Bachelder 2014 Wismer-Parke Vineyard Pinot Noir (Twenty Mile Bench)
description: Scents of clover, stem, green herb and red currant lead into a complex wine that adds sassafras highlights as it glides into a gentle finish. Fermented with wild yeasts and aged 18 months in one-quarter new French oak, this is a well-made, though subtle expression of the variety.

title: Van Duzer 2014 Westside Blocks Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Ripe and toasty, this limited offering hints at slightly raisined fruit. Figs, dried plums and cherry leather all combine, with a rich milk-chocolate finish.

title: Marchiori & Barraud 2014 Malbec (Perdriel)
description: At first the nose on this Malbec seems granulated, with individual notes of heady black fruits, oak, iron and dried blood. The palate is saturated but without much lift. Solid blackberry and chocolate flavors extend across a finish with stature.

title: Bontzu 2014 Carmenère (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: There's no mistaking the variety here, with its notes of red chili pepper and green pepper along with snuffed-out cigar. The palate is broad and generous but still shows elegance, with its cherry and spice flavors. It's an intriguing example of the variety.

title: Saint Gregory 2014 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: Generous Bing cherry and black plum flavors saturate this smooth and full-bodied wine, supplemented by subtle nutmeg, cinnamon and clove notes. It has a suave, mouth-filling texture, soft acidity and a warm spicy finish. Winemaker Greg Graziano blended in 14% Pinotage.

title: Dashwood 2014 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Delicate in style, this Pinot offers pretty aromas of flowers, currant, black olive and smoke. The palate is a little lean but the tannins are silky, and the finish is long and elegant. Drink slightly chilled on a warm fall evening.
